data.title: Not a material girl
data.meta_description: SOMETHING haunts Rose Tremain, a fear in the back of her mind tugging at her contentment. Her mother went blind in the final years of her life. Blindness, which would rob Tremain of the ability to
data.text:
SOMETHING haunts Rose Tremain, a fear in the back of her mind tugging at her contentment. Her mother went blind in the final years of her life. Blindness, which would rob Tremain of the ability to write, would be a particularly bitter fate to befall a person who since childhood has relied on being a teller of tales.

Yet apart from occasional doses of pessimism, which, she explains, come with age — she turns 60 in August — it becomes clear that Tremain has seldom been happier.

She shares her Norwich home — Georgian, part of an elegant mansion divided into three — with her partner, the biographer Richard Holmes. The house seems to float above the city, at the cul de sac summit of
